summaries: The Reaver Shark is a pickaxe available through fishing in the Ocean.

On the <linked>[img:Desktop version]</linked><linked> Desktop version</linked>, <linked>[img:Console version]</linked><linked> Console version</linked>, and <linked>[img:Mobile version]</linked><linked> Mobile version</linked>, it can mine blocks weaker than <linked>Demonite</linked>, <linked>Crimtane</linked> ore, and <linked>Obsidian</linked>.

On the <linked>[img:Old-gen console version]</linked><linked> Old-gen console</linked>, <linked>3DS</linked><linked>[img:Nintendo 3DS version]</linked>, and <linked>[img:Legacy tModLoader version]</linked><linked> Legacy tModLoader</linked> versions, it can mine <linked>Obsidian</linked> and <linked>Hellstone</linked>, which would otherwise require fighting the <linked>Eater of Worlds</linked> or <linked>Brain of Cthulhu</linked> to craft the <linked>Nightmare</linked> or <linked>Deathbringer Pickaxe</linked>. <linked>Hellstone Bars</linked> allow the player to craft Hellstone equipment, which is a major skip of typical <linked>gameplay progression</linked>. On top of that, the Reaver Shark is capable of mining <linked>Cobalt</linked> and <linked>Palladium</linked> ore after the player enters <linked>Hardmode</linked>, meaning a <linked>Molten Pickaxe</linked> does not need to be crafted.
Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.
